channel.title: Publications on Aviva Prins
channel.description: Recent content in Publications on Aviva Prins

item.title: Analyzing Gang Reduction Strategies Through Dynamic Mode Decomposition
item.description: Paper Highlight: Visualization of risk factor changes within the dataset. Risk factor decreases, showing that the program is effective. In the paper, we use Dynamic Mode Decomposition to quantify this conclusion.

item.title: How fat is your piggy bank? An exploration into the predictability of financial well-being using Support Vector Machines
Utilizing Political Campaign Contribution Networks to Identify Political Affiliations and Important Actors in US Elections
item.description: Paper Highlight: Prediction of 2008 Senatorial elections (sans Alaska) using modularity community detection on US donation data.

item.title: PCA and Isomap Analysis
item.description: Paper Highlight: PCA projection of all responses to the questionnaire. Though the risk factors (RFs) are grouped according to value, the overlap is undesirable. The goal is to find an algorithm to reduce the dimensionality of the dataset, such that the risk factors are divided into $n$ groups.

item.title: Theoretical and Experimental Investigation of Bidisperse Particle-Laden Flows on an Incline
item.description: Paper Highlight: Phase diagram of experimentally observed regimes (settled, well-mixed, or ridged) depending on volume ratio $\chi$ and inclination angle $\alpha$.

item.title: Bidensity Particle Laden Flows on an Incline
item.description: Paper Highlight: Progression of a settled regime experiment. The border of the slurry is identified by front tracking code in blue. The time step between screenshots is 12 seconds. In this experiment, $\alpha =50^{\circ}$ and $\chi = 0.5$.

item.title: Constant Flux Particle-laden Viscous Thin Film Flows on an Incline
item.description: Paper Highlight: Experimental setup. Shown is the adjustable incline. On the left is the peristaltic pump.
